IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CREATE VISUAL ARTS EXPERIENCES THAT ENGAGE PEOPLE AND INSPIRE LEARNING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO CREATE VISUAL ARTS EXPERIENCES THAT ENGAGE PEOPLE AND INSPIRE LEARNING THROUGH EXCEPTIONAL EXHIBITIONS, COLLECTIONS, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: EXHIBITIONS - THE MUSEUM PRESENTS A RANGE OF ART EXHIBITIONS ANNUALLY, ADDRESSING A WIDE SPECTRUM OF ARTISTS, ARTISTIC MEDIA, TIME PERIODS AND STYLES, ALL OF WHICH REFLECT DIVERSITY AND EXCELLENCE IN THE VISUAL ARTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION - THE MUSEUM'S EDUCATION PROGRAMS PROVIDE VISITORS WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO HAVE MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES WITH ORIGINAL WORKS OF ART. LECTURES, TOURS, CLASSES, CAMPS, OUTREACH, CATALOGUES, INTERPRETIVE TEXT PANELS, AUDIO TOURS, HANDOUTS, IN-GALLERY MATERIALS, VIDEOS AND TEACHER EDUCATION ENHANCE EXHIBITIONS AND MEET THE LEARNING NEEDS OF PEOPLE OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ART COLLECTION - BOISE ART MUSEUM IS THE ONLY NATIONALLY ACCREDITED COLLECTING ART MUSEUM IN IDAHO THAT ACTIVELY COLLECTS AND CONSERVES VISUAL ART. THE MUSEUM HAS A GROWING COLLECTION OF MORE THAN 4,250 ART OBJECTS COMPRISED OF MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY AMERICAN ART INCLUDING ARTISTS FROM IDAHO AND THE NORTHWEST, AS WELL AS ASIAN AND AFRICAN ART.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES ADDRESSES THE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER TAX BENEFITS CLAIMED OR EXPECTED TO BE CLAIMED ON A TAX RETURN SHOULD BE RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. UNDER THAT GUIDANCE, THE MUSEUM MAY RECOGNIZE TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. THERE WERE NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IDENTIFIED OR RECORDED AS LIABILITIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 2023. THE MUSEUM FILES FORM 990 IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION. THE MUSEUM IS GENERALLY NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FOR YEARS BEFORE 2020.

THE ART COLLECTION ITEMS, WHICH WERE ACQUIRED THROUGH PURCHASES AND CONTRIBUTIONS SINCE THE MUSEUM'S INCEPTION, ARE NOT RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS ON THE STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE ITEMS ARE ACQUIRED OR AS TEMPORARILY OR PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS IF THE ASSETS USED TO PURCHASE THE ITEMS ARE RESTRICTED BY DONORS. CONTRIBUTED COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT REFLECTED IN THE YEAR OF ACQUISITION AS CONTRIBUTED REVENUE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PROCEEDS FROM DEACCESSIONS OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE REFLECTED AS INCREASES IN THE APPROPRIATED NET ASSET CLASSES.

BOISE ART MUSEUM'S PERMANENT COLLECTION HAS BEEN DEVELOPED IN SUPPORT OF THE MUSEUM'S MISSION TO CREATE VISUAL ARTS EXPERIENCES, ENGAGE PEOPLE, AND INSPIRE LEARNING THROUGH EXCEPTIONAL EXHIBITIONS, COLLECTIONS, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. THE SCOPE OF THE COLLECTION IS PRIMARILY AMERICAN MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY ART, WITH ADDITIONAL FOCUS AREAS OF AMERICAN, ASIAN, EUROPEAN, AND ETHNIC ART. BAM'S REPUTATION AS A HIGH CALIBER VISUAL ARTS ORGANIZATION AND ITS STATUS AS THE ONLY NATIONALLY ACCREDITED COLLECTING ART MUSEUM IN IDAHO HAVE LED TO LARGE GIFTS OF ART FROM NATIONALLY KNOWN COLLECTORS. THE MUSEUM CURRENTLY POSSESSES MORE THAN 4,250 OBJECTS, INCLUDING PAINTINGS, SCULPTURES, DRAWINGS, PRINTS, CERAMICS, PHOTOGRAPHS AND ETHNOGRAPHIC MATERIAL. IN ORDER TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC EXPLORATION AND UNDERSTANDING OF THE COLLECTION AND ITS PURPOSE AS A CULTURAL RESOURCE, THE WORKS IN THE PERMANENT COLLECTION REGULARLY FORM THE BASIS FOR BAM'S EXHIBITIONS AND SERVE AS THE BACKBONE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. PERMANENT COLLECTION EXHIBITIONS ARE FEATURED REGULARLY IN LECTURES BY ARTISTS AND ART EXPERTS, DROPIN STUDIO PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS, ART CLASSES AND CAMPS, AS WELL AS THE MUSEUM'S ARTREACH. IN ADDITION, BAM'S FREE ONLINE ARTREACH PROGRAM, WHICH PROVIDES HANDSON ART LESSONS TO STUDENTS IN RURAL CLASSROOMS AND THROUGHOUT IDAHO, CENTERS ON ARTWORKS FROM THE COLLECTION ALONG WITH SELECT TEMPORARY EXHIBITIONS. THESE ESSENTIAL, MISSIONDRIVEN ACTIVITIES DEPEND UPON THE LONGTERM DEVELOPMENT AND PRESERVATION OF THE COLLECTION, MAKING THIS ONE OF THE MUSEUM'S HIGHEST PRIORITIES.

THE ENDOWMENT FUND OF THE BOISE ART MUSEUM WAS ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE A SOURCE OF REVENUE FOR THE BOISE ART MUSEUM'S ACTIVITIES IN PERPETUITY. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS TO PROVIDE THE BOISE ART MUSEUM WITH A FLOW OF INCOME TO DEFRAY THE COST OF OPERATING THE BOISE ART MUSEUM. THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT CAMPAIGN WAS ORIGINALLY LAUNCHED BY THE BOISE ART MUSEUM IN 1982. AFTER 1982, THE ENDOWMENT COMMITTEE PERIODICALLY ADOPTED POLICY STATEMENTS REGARDING THE OPERATION AND INVESTMENT OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND. THE ENDOWMENT COMMITTEE POLICY STATEMENT WAS RESTATED IN ITS ENTIRETY BY THE ENDOWMENT COMMITTEES IN 1989, 2015, AND 2020.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING BODY OF THE ORGANIZATION DELEGATES BROAD AUTHORITY TO ACT ON ITS BEHALF BETWEEN MEETINGS TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF THE OFFICERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND THE IMMEDIATE PAST PRESIDENT OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPLETED COPIES OF THE FORM 990 ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS OF THE MUSEUM. ALL BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEMBERS, STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS ARE REQUIRED TO READ AND SIGN A CODE OF ETHICS POLICY WHICH INCLUDES THE DETAILED CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, WHISTLEBLOWER POLICY AND CODE OF ETHICS FOR ALL MUSEUM RELATED ACTIVITIES. ALL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REQUIRED TO BE REPORTED TO IMMEDIATE SUPERVISORS, THE DIRECTOR OR THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST HAS BEEN REPORTED OR IS DETERMINED TO EXIST, ANY BOARD MEMBERS INVOLVED ARE NOT ALLOWED TO VOTE ON THE ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DETERMINES COMPENSATION USING PROFESSIONAL SALARY REVIEWS FROM MUSEUM PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND NONPROFIT COMPENSATION DATA FOR THE STATE AND REGION. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DETERMINES AND REVIEWS COMPENSATION ANNUALLY. THE LAST COMPENSATION COMPARISON REVIEW WAS PERFORMED IN JANUARY 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND APPROVAL BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
